Reviews.Title: “Pretty great!”
Reviews.Author: Zachs98
Reviews.Content: Well we felt incredibly welcomed by a man that picked us up at the airport, he made us feel welcomed and told us about Phoenix. He later drove my brother and I to go eat, there's also complimentary dinner and breakfast but we missed it. The room was nice, only bad thing was a little stain on the carpet, no bugs, no smells. The pool wasn't heated but we were in Phoenix so it was descent. Pink flowers were in the pool and it was beautiful! Overall it was a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Place to Lay Your Head, That's All”
Reviews.Author: retdeltee
Reviews.Content: Sent here on the Company's dime for training. It's an older hotel, semi reconditioned but not up to par. Room run down, marks on wall, old dust. Small sign at desk says pool and spa are not heated, sorry. In Phoenix in January? Social Hour is free snacks and beer. OK on the beer, not on the snacks! First night room was ready by 3 PM as promised...every other day not. Soap and amenities weak, a bar of soap for a big man lasts 1/2 a day. Centrally located, lots of chain restaurants around. Be careful of the shuttle drivers; they drive FAST!

Reviews.Title: “frequent guest but other locations are better”
Reviews.Author: Dee L
Reviews.Content: I worked near by and thought this was a great location eveything included made it worth it except the one time I was put on the third floor and I had water all over the floor everytime I ran the shower also knew one of the girls at the front desk seemed to always have an attitude I recently switched hotels

Reviews.Title: “best service and hospitality for the money value in the Phoenix area”
Reviews.Author: babybusdriver
Reviews.Content: I travel for a living, the staff and facility at the Clarion Hotel at Phoenix Tech Center are just a joy to be around. Great location great amenities for the money spent. What a great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “We loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: libertybelle24
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a week.The room was very comfortable along with the bed.They give you a cont. bkfast and also feed you a little something at nignt,with complementry drinks.It was perfect for the money.We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Quick weekend turnaround”
Reviews.Author: zelda302
Reviews.Content: My son was visiting a university in AZ. We just need a room with a bed and a bath for a quick 2 night weekend. This hotel served that purpose. The best thing about the room was the beds. The beds and bedding were top of the line. The furniture and bath fixtures were not. If you are looking for a good nights sleep for a great price, this is your hotel. If you are more into a luxurious vacation, this may not be the place for you. The pool was noisy and crowded. Our door overlooked the pool deck from the second floor and we heard hooting and hollaring after 10:00 at night. Several people also ate their comp breakfast on the pool deck, so the pool was busy around the clock. The lobby facilities and staff were excellent. Food was offered at breakfast time, but also around dinnertime every evening. Free tacos, or pasta and a beer and wine bar in the comfortable lobby. Very clean and well maintained. We spent a lot of our waking time at the hotel in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Best value for $$.”
Reviews.Author: eqjim
Reviews.Content: Best value for $$. Really great staff. Clean rooms. Great pillows. Great mattress. Big pool. Good TV. Prompt shuttle service to places you want to go in the immediate area. Exceptional breakfast. You even get food at the PM "social hour" including a small salad bar and hot dish. You get so much more than what you would expect for the price. Treadmills in workout room are in good shape. Reliable FREE internet service (reliable internet is crucial for me). I have stayed at 4 star hotels in Phoenix ...where I paid 50% more ...and received 100% less. The Clarion may not be shiney new & impressive on the surface but, this really is THE BEST VALUE for the dollar!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and great amenities”
Reviews.Author: kit444
Reviews.Content: I had a pleasant 2-night stay. The pool area was very nice (pool depth max. 5 feet, hot hot tub, open until 10p, not loud) and the rooms were okay (clean but not fancy, could use updating). What I was really impressed with were the amenities: free wi-fi, complimentary breakfast, shuttle to airport, and a manager's social hour (free tap beer -- including Blue Moon -- and wine with a salad bar and a different hot entree each night). It runs from 5:30-7p. The staff was great too.

Reviews.Title: “Quality masquerading as Clarion - Not bad, but definitely not upscale.”
Reviews.Author: TANSTAAFL1
Reviews.Content: Just a quick overnight with spouse. Although it is located in the Tech Center Business Park with few amenities in walking distance, there are ample shopping and eating/drinking choices within a 5-minute drive. Desk staff were friendly and professional. The breakfast and manager reception were more than expected. The rooms are clean and the bed seemed new, but are otherwise cheaply furnished and decorated, sparsely appointed, and definitely need updating. This property is really more suited to the Quality brand - it definitely doesn't feel upscale. I agree with the previous reviewer that there are better options in the area for the price. The pool area is large and well-kept, and there is free wi-fi, a large fitness room and a guest laundy.

Reviews.Title: “Caring Staff”
Reviews.Author: GinaBays
Reviews.Content: I was traveling and got sick at the airport. I have Blood Pressure issues and I was sent to the Emergency Room. I got released after I was stable at 3am in the morning. I was very unfamiliar with my surroundings, sick and weak. I called the hotel and told them my situation; the manager himself actually came and picked me up. The hospital staff they most likely would not, but cared enought to go out of their way. I will always remember this! This is one company who has not forgot how to treat their guest... Thank You, Gina Bays

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and a great deal”
Reviews.Author: suzie047
Reviews.Content: stayed here one night when we got bumped from a flight. we were given a discount coupon from the airline, but even so, it was a great deal - good beds and shower, free shuttle to airport and nearby shopping, happy hour with draft beer, enchiladas and salad, and a great breakfast. and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: thumper1
Reviews.Content: We were picked up by the shuttle and the driver told us all about the hotel. He also told us that the shuttle would take us anywhere within 5 miles if they were not doing airport pickups. Our room had a small refrigerator and microwave. It was a first floor room that was wheelchair accessible -- something that we had not requested but may have been all that was available. There was no bathroom door to accommodate a wheelchair -- so you might want to make your wishes known. We booked an AARP rate and thought that might be the reason for the particular room. They have a salad bar with a hot entree (Salisbury steak and mashed potato the night we were there) and wine and beer every night. In the morning, there is a breakfast buffet that included waffles, eggs, bacon and sausage as well as cold items and beverages. They also had a pool, small gym, and free wi-fi connections. We rode the shuttle to the casino and called for a ride when we were ready to go back. I thought it was a very good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Col04
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about the Clarion. It was conviently located. The room was very clean, air conditioner worked great. Everything was very clean. The price was great and included a breakfast and hot meal in the evening, with a 3 hour "happy hour". Staff was very helpful. Close to Casinos, the one we went to was about a 15/20 minute ride. Close to restaurants, shopping and airport. Would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Loud in the daytime, but definitely economical”
Reviews.Author: backmask
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights. The staff was a bit cold at check-in. We'd requested a quiet room on a higher floor when we booked the reservation, since the hotel has exterior hallways, but when we checked in, the desk attendant assigned us a room on the first floor. Had to reiterate my request, but it was taken care of. This hotel is definitely a place for families, as there seemed to be a ton of little kids running around everywhere and making a ton of noise in the daytime. Luckily we weren't there much in the day, as we were in town for a little business and a family get-together. There were black hairs on the bed and weird stains on the pillowcases, so we didnt use the pillows or blanket. The room was pretty dated, but the hotel had a lot of open areas and ashtrays every five feet. The only major pluses of this hotel were the free hot breakfast, and the manager's social hour that offered free beer or wine and a free dinner. Definitely saved movey on meals while on our trip by staying at this hotel. I asked for an orange slice to go with my blue moon, only to be told by the attendant that she didn't feel like cutting one for me. Huh? Yeah its a free drink, but i was still going to tip, but not after that rude comment. Stay here if youre broke like me and dont mind crazy hellion kids ruining your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Never again would I stay in a Clarion Hotel”
Reviews.Author: monabona_10
Reviews.Content: Very Noisy, and I'm not talking about the highway traffic. The room had an odor, a/c didnt work correctly, hairs all over the restroom floor and the bed looked like somebody already slept in it. Very disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, tired hotel with lots of noise - suggest looking for accommodations elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: montereydream
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night after getting off an overbook flight at the Phoenix Airport. Hotel was paid for by the airline. The hotel is overall fairly clean, but the rooms are dated, cramped, musty and in need of updating. Staff is friendly and helpful. I would say the room was clean - except for a rather disgusting soiled down bedcover. I was totally turned off after that. There is a pool and hot tub that looked nice - but there were kids/teens in the pool yelling and carrying on like rock stars until quite late at night. There is little insulation between rooms and you can hear people talking, opening doors, etc. I would suggest finding another hotel before booking a room here.

Reviews.Title: “I was surprised at how pleasant my stay was!!”
Reviews.Author: squid1213
Reviews.Content: As stranded airline passengers, we weren't happy about staying at a hotel overnight. The Clarion supplied the shuttle to and from the airport, checked us in instantly with no difficulties, provided us with a very decent room, and gave us a very nice complimentary breakfast. The room had ammenities that were greatly appreciated like fridge, coffee maker, iron, hair dryer, etc. We never encounted anyone that wasn't friendly and respectful. AAAAA+++++ from us!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service experience”
Reviews.Author: BoisePapa
Reviews.Content: Had to find a place to stay on a Thursday night after a missed connecting flight and got this location from the airline resource. The Shuttle picked me up at 10:30 p.m. (free). I checked in quickly and obtained a late checkout with no hassle (flight didn't leave 'til 8:00p.m. the next night and the hotel wasn't very busy!). The room was quiet, clean, and comfortable, offering a choice of down or alternate material filled pillows-- has cable TV, fridge, microwave, coffee maker, iron & board, hair dryer, and internet access. They also provide Nutrogena toiletries. Water from the room faucet was a little brackish, but the ice machine provided filtered water ice that was very pleasant when melted, so I drank that. The fitness facility is available 24 hrs and the outdoor pool and hot tub were clean and available 10 - 10. The complimentary breakfast was very nice with good variety (premade omelettes, bacon, pastry and toast, cereal, waffles, fruit, and several juices) and the evening "Manager's Social Hour" offered a complimentary hot meal choice with a simple tossed salad bar and drinks. Checkout took about 3 minutes and the shuttle driver was friendly and efficient. I was very favorably impressed and would seek this place out if needing overnight accommodations in the Phoenix area again.

Reviews.Title: “Pet Friendly and People Friendly”
Reviews.Author: travelingforfun13
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great. It was pet friendly and very people friendly. The hotel rooms have recently been redone and are very nice. They not only have a hot breakfast, but they also serve a free dinner. What a deal. It is right off the freeway though amazingly quiet. Even the owner has their pet there. Very cool

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: bergroup
Reviews.Content: Have stayed at this property 5 times, most recently in April, 2008. The staff is very friendly and treats guests well. The breakfast is good and their Happy Hour (5:30 - 8:00 PM) is a great way to unwind after a long day. The rooms are clean but are in need of an update. For the price ($135) there are other hotels in the area that are better appointed. The pool area is nice and they have free wi-fi and guest laundy available. All in all I would recommend this hotel with only a few reservations.

Reviews.Title: “wow!”
Reviews.Author: julia_hiker
Reviews.Content: The Clarion is fantastic! We got bumped off our flight and the airline put us up here. It is a beautiful little place with a nice pool, weight room, complimentary breakfast and complimentary evening snacks. The lobby area has a fireplace, bar, and comfortable chairs. The room itself has a refrigerator,microwave, 2 coffee makers, hairdryer, etc. They offer free shuttles to and from the airport 24 hours a day. (In the morning, they leave every hour on the hour to the airport.) I don't know what the price is, but this is a lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Pleasant Stay”
Reviews.Author: dallyup101
Reviews.Content: We took a gamble with Hotwire and wound up with the Clarion for one night. Upon driving up to the hotel we were a little doubtful but were pleasantly surpsrised. The room was very clean, the bed comfortable, the shower amazing all with a very clean grounds. We were also surprised by their complimentary happy hour where they served wine and beer and their complimentary HOT breakfast. Very well organized and thoughtful staff. The hotel was also very conveniently located to area attractions. We would definitely consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't forget to lock your door at night!”
Reviews.Author: parsley
Reviews.Content: Oh. My. God. I have never stayed anywhere, where TWICE in one night, other guests tried to come into our room. They weren't breaking and entering... the first was an honest family, given a set of keys for OUR room, when we were already checked in. The second time, I don't know who it was--but they had keys. Both times, it was 2am and then 6am in the morning. Then the overly eager housekeeping service walked in at 8am without knocking. It was so bad, it was funny. The room itself was clean, they have a fridge to keep food items, and they have a free wine/beer hour with a small buffet and free booze. Free is awesome as long as you are not picky about quality. At the end and beginning of the stay, Mike or Mark or whomever the night manager is, was completely rude, unapologetic and blamed all of our problems on other people, specifically, his employees. My opinion regarding that is poor employee performance reflects poor training and management. Which had nothing to do with us, yet he took it out on us. And his attitude was rude. If he would have had a better attitude or at least been polite about it all, we would have easily been easy going about it. I typically have reasonable expectations for the hotel industry. But this experience just set a new record for rudeness. I encourage a response from this specific hotel, simply because I am astonished that our experience even happened. I'd be amused to hear what explanation they have, provided it's at least a little different from the one we heard at the hotel, which was "it's all my employee's fault."

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced motel”
Reviews.Author: Sabine_D
Reviews.Content: We booked two nights via Hotwire, looking for a 3-star hotel in the CHANDLER area. What we got was a 2-star (barely) MOTEL next to the interstate, not actually in Chandler. A group of college students had taken over the hot tub/pool area and 2nd floor walkway the first evening. The noise was so bad in our room that I called three times to complain. I wound up having to turn the TV on to mask the noise so that my five year-old could go to sleep. The property itself is a motel. This is NOT a hotel. The bedclothes and pillows were about as cheap as they come, scratchy... The state of our room was pretty bad. Dirty carpet. The upholstery on the desk chair was so stained with something sticky that we couldn't use it. Yuck. My husband, who is not a picky person, hated this place so much that we checked out a day early, which meant throwing away the nonrefundable payment we'd already made for the room through Hotwire. So be it. The only good news was that when I called Hotwire to tell them about how unhappy we were with the property, they gave us a credit in the amount of 93 dollars, which is what we were charged per night. That seemed fair. I would say that the Clarion is fine if you want to stay someplace crappy and pay WAY too much for it. The only thing it has going for it is that it is very conveniently located next to the highway.

Reviews.Title: “What a Dump”
Reviews.Author: circuitboitravel
Reviews.Content: I can't even begin to start about how awful this place is. Don't stay here, go across the street and stay at the bestwestern or go over the over pass and stay at the Country Inn Suites, or up the I-10 and stay at the Arizona Mills area. Parking, you know when you are not in a good area, when the hotel post's signs all over, to not leave anything in your car. The hotel is not responceable for items stolen .... I should have run when I saw that, and I am telling you to RUN out of there! The hotel is a complete nightmare! No internet dataports, The beds were Horrible, I actually ended up on the floor because it was more comfortable. The hotel manager was conducting an interview in the small lobby and everyone could hear what he was saying. The free meals, Shabby at best, but I will say they tried. Pool was infested in bugs. There were more bugs on the top of the water and it just grossed me out.

HotelInfo.Name: Clarion Hotel Phoenix Tech Center
HotelInfo.Address: 5121 E La Puenta Ave, I-10 & Elliot Rd, Phoenix, AZ 85044-5212
